fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Go to an issue on jira.atlassian.com.
2. Click "Link this issue to another issue".
3. Drop-down menu shows two items that shouldn't be there:
- jira_subtask_outward
- jira_subtask_inward
fields.summary: Link types drop-down on Create Link screen shows "jira_subtask" links

fields.description: I wanted to step through workflow with bulk operations. I choosed two issues, that are assigned to different workflows. Then I could only choose for one workflow the workflow action (see attachment)
fields.summary: Problems with bulk operation "Transition Issues"
Textfield for unlimited text is too small

fields.description:
I found it while attaching a file via a [Python SOAP client|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+a+SOAP+Client?focusedCommentId=180943#comment-180943]. Tested with [Jelly|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/jelly.html#AttachFile] too and the same thing happened.

Seems like the {{AttachmentManager}}'s {{isAttachable()}} method is not used.
fields.summary: Able to add attachments regardless of "Allow Attachments" being set as OFF

fields.description:
If you select Japanese langauge in your profile and are using the DateTime picker custom filed, picking from the calendar fills a date time value in the field, but you get an error message regarding its format. Please see screenshot attached.

To resolve this, if the user manually changes the text "AM" to "午前" or "PM" to "午後", the create issue form can thus be submitted.

If this an issue with our translations or with the code?
fields.summary: Datetime picker custom field does not work properly for Japanese user

fields.description: You added some new functionality, "Disable Mail Notification for Bulk Operations", in which I can de-select a checkbox if I don't want an email to be sent when I change the issues.  How can I administrate JIRA so that this setting is de-selected by default?  Because the checkbox is at the bottom of the page, if I am changing a large dataset, it is easy to forget to de-select the checkbox.
fields.summary: Add administrative feature to de-select "Disable Mail Notification for Bulk Operations", by default.

fields.description:
Example:  A saved filter displays 9 issues. 4 are Bugs, and 5 are Development. The workflows for these two issue types are different.

- From the Issue Navigator, clicked on "Bulk Change (all 9 Issues)"
- Selected *all* 9 issues in step 1 of the process.
- Selected "Transition issues through workflow "
- In Step 3, the issues are displayed in 2 groups, depending on their workflow type.  The bug is the behavior of the radio buttons. The user is restricted to make workflow changes for only ONE of the groups of issues, not BOTH.  The process was initiated as "change all", but does not function in this manner. In this scenario, in order to change all 9 issues, the Bulk Change must be initiated twice!
fields.summary: Bulk Change - Unable to perform simultaneous transitions for multiple workflow types
Possibility to search issues for NON ARCHIVED or ARCHIVED versions

More details upon request.

fields.description:
Currently, we have an issue security scheme that specifies a security level of "Reporter plus support." Of course, the "Users/Groups" for this level is "Reporter" plus the group of users that comprise the support folks. This has worked really well for us.

Some of our "customers" have more than one user that submits issues, and they would like to see all the issues reported by their "company."

Rather than try to manage this with separate groups (one for each customer, I would like to try this:

We need something like a "Reporter Domain" user/group and when this is specified, security checks would work similar to the "Reporter" user. But instead of comparing the id of the current signed-on user with the id of the reporter of the issue, compare the e-mail domain of the signed-on user with the "reporterdomain" custom field (that is implemented by one of the Atlassian supplied plug-ins) in the issue.

We would like to see this as both an issue security level and as a transition condition.

Clearly the execution code change is very small. The trick is going to be getting this configurable, translated, documented, etc.

A portion of this is already implemented in that we already have the "reporterdomain" field configured. 

Of course, using e-mail for this introduces it's own set of requirements on registration. For example, there needs to be a flag in configuration to require e-mail verification. That is, it should not be possible for someone to register with an e-mail address of tom@mycompany.com and then be able to look at all issues reported by anyone at mycompany.com without at least going through mycompany's e-mail system first.
fields.summary: Add "reporter domain" permission

fields.description:
Exporting as "Excel" as a means of getting CSV is a dodgy hack.

 - It means that exporting CSV is an operation that requires human intervention (ie. no automated services based off it)
 - It requires MS Excel, which not everyone has (oocalc won't even open the file, instead passing it off to oowriter).
 - It exposes one to the vagaries of spreadsheets. Try storing "2006-07-18 08:46:36.382085" in a *text* field. Excel and OpenOffice interpret it as a date, whether you like it or not, and lose precision when exporting as CSV. Spreadsheets could well break encoding when they interpret and save the contents.

JIRA should have a native "Export as CSV" option.
fields.summary: JIRA needs real CSV output

fields.description:
On the browse project screen there are a number of preset filters which presently cannot be defined.

The term 'recently' is subjective and should therefore be definable by the user. Users may also wish to choose which filters are displayed here without having to view portlets on the dashboard.
fields.summary: Define preset filters on browse project screen

fields.description:
When adding or removing groups from a user, clicking on {{leave}} or {{join}} should just reload the page (with the changes applied).  At the momment it returns to User Browser.

(We could be funky and do it Ajax style...)
fields.summary: Adding/Removing groups to/from a user should reload same page

fields.description: TestAutoExport is implemented using datestamp-based expected filename generation which requires that each test completes execution within the same clock second. This has been known to fail and waste people's time.
fields.summary: Fix TestAutoExport to be deterministic

fields.description:
Reproduction sequence:
1. Create an issue in one product, say, AAA-1
2. Move it to another product. For example, it becomes BBB-2
3. Send the following request:
    http://jira/browse/AAA-1?decorator=none&view=rss

Observed:
    the request is redirected to http://jira/browse/BBB-2?rc=1decorator=none&view=rss
    because there is no "&" after "rc=1", the resulting page is not an XML view

Expected:
    the request is redirected to http://jira/browse/BBB-2?rc=1&decorator=none&view=rss
fields.summary: After issue is moved, redirection to the new url mangles url parameters

fields.description: When creating a search request you can specify the columns and also ordering. It would be beneficial if this information could be preserved in the XML view of an issue, similar to the Excel view.
fields.summary: XML view for a Search Request should adhere to the column selection in the search request.

I need to be able to get emails when issues are commented on.  I am a JIRA administrator.

fields.description:
We've recently gotten the SOAP4R working through Ruby (http://jira4r.rubyhaus.org/) and are starting to try and automate Codehaus's JIRA instance (jira.codehaus.org)

Unfortunately we've run into some performance stumbling blocks.

getProjects() takes over 2 minutes to return (and around 4M of data) - we have 288 projects
getProjectsNoSchemes() takes 20s to return (and around 200K of data).

Neither of these are satisfactory, as we often need to update the project and can not do this without the permission information being in the RemoteProject object.

We're wondering if you could add a getProject(projectKey) interface; for completeness you  might want getProjectByKey, getProjectById (however we don't actually need this at present).


Thanks,

Ben
fields.summary: New method request for JIRA SOAP interface - getProject

fields.description:
Free Text fields that are included in the Issue Navigator can have very large multiline values. These can be shown/hidden in the Display Issue page and we should add the same functionality to the Issue Navigator where space is at an even greater premium.

To implement this, we need to copy the "view-textarea.vm" AND include support for individual row identifiers (issue id) on the divs. Then, add these as "column-view" resources in the correct *-customfieldtypes-plugin.xml

For the System fields (Description and Environment) you need to change the *-columnview.vm the same way you did for the custom fields.
fields.summary: Add Hide/Show functionality for Free Text Custom & System fields in the Issue Navigator
Search does not match file paths

fields.description:
For JIRA 3.6.2, I tried to follow the intruction to add Custom Field value to email notification: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Adding+Custom+Fields+to+Email

I found out that $issue.getCustomFieldValue("customfield_10000") does not return anything. Instead, $issue.getCustomField("customfield_10000") returns something. For example, printing out $issue.getCustomField("customfield_10000") or $issue.getCustomField("customfield_10000").name returns the name of the specified custom field. However, the actual cutom field values associated with the issue cannot be retrieved even though clearly, they exist.

I have tried the following commands in the velocity template, but they all fails to return any value:
$issue.getCustomFieldValue( "10000" )
$issue.getCustomFieldValue( "customfield_10000" )
$issue.getCustomField("customfield_10000") -> returns the name of the customer field
$issue.getCustomFieldValue( $issue.getCustomField("customfield_10000") )
$issue.getCustomField("customfield_10000").customFieldValue
$issue.getCustomField("customfield_10000").value
$issue.getCustomField("customfield_10000").value($issue)
$issue.getCustomField("customfield_10000").getValue($issue)
$issue.getCustomField("customfield_10000").getValue($issue).name
$issue.getCustomField("customfield_10000").getValue($issue).value
$issue.getCustomField("customfield_10000").getValueFromIssue($issue)
$issue.getCustomField("customfield_10000").getValueFromParams($params)
$issue.getCustomField("customfield_10000").getCustomFieldValues($params).transformObjectsToStrings()

What is the right command to retrieve the custom field value from velocity template?
fields.summary: Incorrect instruction for adding custom field value to email notification

fields.description:
Filters are under utilised in general use of JRIA and i think they can become a more integral part of the way we use jira.

I have about 10 filters but never use them in general use (only for portlets).

I think part of the issue is that they are clumsy to select, you should be able to quickly navigate to a filter result no matter what page you are on.

The best (easiest) way to do this would be to have the hover over on the already existing {{filter}} link have a list of clickable links (Similar to the ajaxy search from Confluence).

Else we can move the filters link to the Main bar (after {{Find Issues}}).  I think renaming it to {{Saved Searches}} would also be benificial.
fields.summary: Make filters more accessible

fields.description:
I do like the tool. I am used to "bugtrack" that is indeed pretty much less engineered wrt to your tool. But we have a stong commitment : keep users restricted to see only the projects for which they are configured to have access to.
I see from the DEMO that login and password is to enter new requests but any user can access to any project to get statistics, list of bugs, etc etc.
Is there some administation configuration allowing to set such restrictions also in the view?
Can I define a "project" permissions, all along users lists?
Can we restrict "folders", "projects", "action types" (suc has "enter a bug", "close a bug", "edit a bug", "add a comment"....) for each user of set of users (sometihing like a group meaning)?
Is anything of what we described in yout roadmap?
Thanks for you kind feedback
Antonio

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-10639].
  {panel}

I am not sure this is a feature or a bug.
I have a project with multiple components. Some issues belong to more than one component.
If I filter on component x and component y I want the issues having x AND y, instead I get all issues having x OR y. 
And I am not able to use the search expression.
fields.summary: Filter on multiple components produces 'OR' result while I expect 'AND' result

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-10638].
  {panel}

JRA-10205 was reported regarding the displaying of issue summary, reported and assignee, type and status on certain issue operations when not logged in. For 3.6.3 the solutions was to simply throw an IssuePermissionException when the user doesn't have Browse Issue permission for that issue. Please see that issue for a description of how it was done and what files were touched.

However, it was noted that there were at least four different ways the Issue actions might report this to the user.
# Custom handling in the operation view. Creates a very nice error page with the operation, and friendly error message - http://server/jira/secure/AddComment!default.jspa?id=12345
# "You are not logged in" message with standard Jira banner, user gets redirected to permission-violation page (permissionviolation.jsp), not so friendly, but the user gets the point - http://server/jira/secure/ViewIssue.jspa?id=12345 (note, this page has trackback info)
# "Access Denied" message with big red background, user gets redirected to security-breach page (securitybreach.jsp) with standard Jira banner, not so friendly big red message, user still gets the point - http://server/jira/secure/attachment/12345/logs_jira-int_11_03_2005.txt or the ViewVoters or ManageWatchers urls (no trackback info). 
# 500 page catches IssuePermissionException, very, very unfriendly message, lots of nasty logging.

{note}all the Admin pages use the securitybreach.jsp{note}

These need to be standardised so all access denied reports are the same, and it is not possible to view any secure information if you do not have that permission.

While researching JRA-10205 the following was noted:
- IssuePermissionException is handled inconsistently. We need to either throw it from our Action.doValidate(), Action.doExecute() & Action.doDefault() methods or handle it in a consistent manner.
- We probably should handle the standard case in the framework. AbstractIssueSelectAction holds the issueObject, and should be able to handle 99% of the code paths. Attached is a version that does the 99% (doesn't handle the trackback case)
- We could further generify the issue handling of Actions by having them implement some kind of IssueAware interface and have an interceptor of the filter stack read the request parameters and insert the Issue into the action. This could also have a PermissionException injector method as well if the user cannot see an issue. (Please ask Scott for further information, as this is his idea).
- The trackback info is the wrinkle edge-case, we do actually have to provide some issue info in the trackback rdf if enabled.

Final caveat: The permission error page actually DOES HAVE TO HAVE the issue summary in it (if incoming trackbacks are turned on) in the trackback RDF. This currently works if the permissionviolation.jsp is the result (which it is for ViewIssue). We probably need to have a separate TrackbackIssueInfo object that the Issue can give us that is filtered through a trackback policy filter. Then we can have a trackback policy for enabling/disabling trackbacks based on their security (for instance allow trackbacks for public issues only, rinse issue summary from non public issues etc.)

fields.description:
When one Jira project is integrated with multiple CVS modules, it's difficult to tell which module a source file is in; would be nice if the path in the filename included the CVS module name.

For instance, if Jira were made up of two modules, {{jira}} and {{jira-extensions}}, each of which had a directory {{source/java/main}}, it'd be nice to see entries such as {{jira/source/java/main/com/atlassian/jira/JiraServlet.java}}.  That way, you'd know it's not in the {{jira-extensions}} module.

fields.description:
Taken from PERF-96:

{quote}
Steps to reproduce:

   1. Create an issue
   2. Add the P4 Job checkbox field
   3. Execute a search through Issue Navigator looking for all issues without a P4 job.
   4. Search returns no matching issues.

Expected behaviour - return issue created before addition of custom field.

Note: A similar search for all issues with or without P4 jobs returns the issue.
{quote}
fields.summary: PERF-96 - Issues created before the addition of the P4 Job checkbox are not returned in the "Without Job" search in Issue Navigator

fields.description:
This is kinda related to JRA-1389.

If you have public browsing turned off, when a user clicks on a project or issue URL (in an email, on a maven site, etc), they end up at an error page. It would be much better if the user instead ended up at the login page (perhaps with an error message) rather than an error page like this.

"ERROR
You cannot view this URL as a guest. You must login or signup for an account. 
If you feel this message is wrong, please consult your administrators about getting the necessary permissions."

In fact, reaching this page is not really an error - its part of the normal usage of Jira.

What we find is that peoples' initial reaction is "oops, whats wrong".
For those that know what is going on, its just an extra unnecessary click in the way of their login page.

-Nick

fields.description:
We would like the ability to edit comments in JIRA. We would like this as we find that sometimes comments have spelling mistakes or small inaccuracies. This may seem trivial but as soon as a comment no longer is spelt correctly it is no longer searchable. fields.description:
Mike has improved the performance of the view issue page by making the following changes:

- Caching user preferences, rather than fetching them.  This is done on a LRU basis
- IssueSecuritySchemeManager now caches its schemes
- DefaultIssueLinkManager caches links on a LRU basis
- ProjectCache now has a getProjectByID method
- DefaultWorkflowSchemeManager now has a LRU cache

This reduces the number of SQL queries that are produced for a single view issue page.
fields.summary: Port 3.6.3 performance improvements to HEAD

fields.description: When performing a bulk edit, there are times it would be helpful NOT to update the date last updated. For example, if I do a mass edit of issues to change their security level, this is an internal adjustment and does not affect developers' schedules. Chnaging the date last updated adversely affects developers who receive daily subscriptions sorted by date last updated. Another use case could be a mass edit of Fix version. Think about what you guys did this week. You did a bulk edit to move a bunch of issues from Fix For 3.6.3 to 3.6.4. So now they all show as having been updated this week even though nothing else has been done to them. If the person performing the bulk edit was a member of the administrators group, perhaps they could have an additional checkbox to decide whether to update the date or not for each bulk edit.
fields.summary: Provide option to not update Date Updated on Bulk Edit

fields.description: I signed up for an account at jira.atlassian.com and my password was emailed to me in plain text.  Passwords should never be handled this way.  A password should be hashed with md5 or another function and the hash of the password stored.  When the user logs in the password he gives is then hashed with the same function and the hashes are compared.  This way, if the database is compromised, your user's passwords are not.  Emailing passwords should _NEVER_ be done.  Emails are routinely archived in many US businesses (our government thinks its a good idea) and reviewed by people who do not have, for example, my access level.  By emailing my password, you may have given a DBA access to non-public information which they are not authorized to have.
fields.summary: DON'T SEND PASSWORDS OVER THE INTERNET IN PLAIN TEXT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

fields.description:
If there is a service that cannot be found on startup it will prevent others from starting

Way to reproduce the problem:
1) Install SVN plugin in JIRA 3.5.1
2) Go to Administration \-> System\-> Services, you will see a service added named "Subversion Revision Indexing Service" (only if SVN plugin is installed properly)
3) Create another service. For example:  Create issues from POP (PopService)
4) Remove the atlassian-jira-subversion-plugin.jar (Subversion Revision Indexing Service will not be started)
5) Turn on debug mode and you can see PopService is not running (Without any error or warning log)
fields.summary: Services failed running if preceding one fails

fields.description:
Allow the CSV importer to re-use a user based soley on the fullname.

For example, if an Assignee in the import (e.g. John Doe) matches a Full Name in Jira (e.g. John Doe), Jira should choose that pre-existing user for the Assignee.

At present, the CSV import will expect the username to be a lowercase concatenation of the fullname or a lowercase first initial concatentation with lastname based on the mapper that is used.

For example, if a user with username _jdoe_ and fullname _John Doe_ exists within JIRA - the CSV import will create a new user with username _johndoe_ and fullname _John Doe_. In this case, the pre-existing user should have been used.
fields.summary: CSV Import: Provide a new name mapper to allow re-use of existing JIRA users

fields.description:
Accessing other users profile shows their real names and mail addresses. 

Our installation contains a project for each customer, thus offering our customers to upload their private data to our issue tracker (if they insist to do so) without issue-level security that's available in the enterprise edition. However, accessing the user profile for other users needs an account name and reveals their real name as well as their Email-Address. Luckily it does show only projects accessible to the currently logged in user.

Though the installation at jira.atlassian.com is a lot more public than our installation, see my own profile for what's visible to anybody. http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=oko

As said, in basically public installations, this is ok. In restricted environments this shows too much information to everybody.

This might be related to JRA-10205 (?)

fields.description:
Hello, over the last week we've been observing a strange bug in JIRA.  When creating a new project's milestones through the soap interface they no longer showed up in the browser when viewing the projects admin page.  Creating a new milestone through the admin page revealed both the milestone just created and the milestone created via the soap interface, however the milestones created via the web page did not show up in the soap interface.  

I should also point out that at no part of this preliminary testing did any error messages show up or anything in the xml response to indicate that the results from the API calls where inconsistent with the info on the admin page.  As far as our app was concerned nothing was wrong at all until we tried to use the milestones and they didn't exist or we noticied the discrepancy verifying manually.

I tried making several milestones through both methods then deleting them all.  the milestones deleted from the admin page which had been created through the soap interface still showed up in the soap calls even though they were deleted.  At this point trying to create any milestone through the soap interface resulted in an error "geric entity not found".  I tried explicity calling "log out" thinking that maybe something wasn't being flushed to DB, but that had no effect.  restarting my app had no effect, and it still failed when I wrote a small standalone app just to check to see if a recent change in our code had caused the bug.

I dont know why it happened but we did discover that restarting jira seemed to solve the sync issue between the interface and the admin page.  Restarting jira which had otherwise been running fine for ~1.5 months is a measure that we would prefer to avoid in the future.  

Even though the SOAP api returned a Generic Entity Not Found exception and a few null pointer execeptions on several occasions threre were no related error messages in the logs :S sorry.  I'm not sure you'll be able to reproduce this bug without logs (or waiting a few months), but at least you'll be aware that it exists.
fields.summary: Versions become unsynced between manage project page and soap api calls after a few months
